text: Michael Sata, the President of Zambia died on 28 October 2014 in London, United Kingdom."Zambian President Michael Sata dies in London", BBC News – Africa, 29 October 2014. The state funeral took place on November 11 with the funeral being attended by 9 heads of state, 9 foreign representatives, 2 heads of multilateral organizations and 2 former African political leaders. ==Background== On 19 October 2014, Sata left the country for a medical check- up in the United Kingdom, leaving Defence Minister Edgar Lungu in charge in his absence."Zambian President Michael Sata goes for medical check-up", BBC News, 20 October 2014."Party rivalries grow as Sata ails", Africa Confidential, volume 55, number 21, 24 October 2014. Sata's absence from public view, given that the 50th anniversary of the country's independence was 4 days away, rumours emerged on the status of Sata's health. He died in London on 28 October at King Edward VII Hospital alongside his wife, Christine, son, Mulenga, and other family members."Zambian President Michael Sata dies in London", BBC News – Africa, 29 October 2014. Vice-President Guy Scott was named acting leader until an election, making him the first democratically elected white leader of a Sub-Saharan African government since F. W. de Klerk in South Africa. ==Dignitaries== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Country ! Title !
